534.question: What different correlations result when using different variants of ROUGE scores?
534.response: {'Answer': "Different variants of ROUGE scores may yield varying correlations with human judgments, depending on the specific dataset and evaluation criteria. For example, when evaluating summaries based on Pyramid, SERA-DIS-KW-5 achieved the highest correlations, whereas SERA-DIS-NP-10 yielded the strongest correlations for ROUGE-2-F and ROUGE-3-F."}
534.answer: Using Pearson corelation measure,  for example, ROUGE-1-P is 0.257 and ROUGE-3-F 0.878.
